key_mistakes.reason: e3 weakens the pawn structure and allows Black to capitalize on the central control.
Moving the knight to the edge of the board reduces its influence in the center.
Leaving the queen on an undefended square makes it vulnerable to attacks.
Weakens the king's safety and does not contribute to specific threats.
Exposing king to checks in the center of the board.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with pawns and pieces.
Avoid unnecessary pawn weaknesses that can expose the king.
Improve piece activity by keeping pieces centralized and coordinated.
Maintain a solid pawn structure to support piece mobility.
Watch for tactics such as forks, pins, and skewers to avoid blunders.
